verses.verse: (A thanksgiving of the faithful for the mercies of God.) And thou (He showeth how the Church shall praise God, when they are delivered from their captivity.) shalt say in that day, O Lord, I will praise thee: though thou wast angry with me, thy wrath is turned away, and thou comfortest me.

Behold, God is my (Our salvation standeth only in God, who giveth us an assured confidence, constancy, and occasion, to praise him for the same.) salvation: I will trust, and will not fear: for the Lord God is (Cross references: : Exod. 15:2; Ps. 118:14) my strength and song: he is also become my salvation.
Therefore with joy shall ye (The graces of God shall be so abundant, that ye may receive them in as great plenty, as waters out of a fountain that is full.) draw waters out of the wells of salvation.
And ye shall say in that day, (1 Chron. 16:8) Praise the Lord: call upon his Name: declare his works among the people: make mention of them, for his Name is exalted.
Sing unto the Lord, for he hath done excellent things: this is known in all the world.
Cry out, and shout, (Ye that are of the Church.) O inhabitant of Zion: for great is the Holy one of Israel in the midst of thee.
